hero_description: Comprehensive preclinical validation for bradycardia pacing devices with electrical performance characterization, sensing algorithm verification, lead system biocompatibility assessment, and battery longevity evaluation using GLP-compliant methodologies for regulatory submissions.
primary_content_description:
Cardiac pacemakers sustain life through reliable electrical stimulation, requiring validation that demonstrates consistent sensing, appropriate pacing, and battery longevity across varying physiological conditions. Pacemakers must detect intrinsic cardiac activity while delivering therapy that maintains adequate heart rate without depleting battery reserves prematurely. Single-chamber systems demand precise ventricular pacing validation while dual-chamber platforms require complex atrial-ventricular synchronization assessment and rate-responsive devices need sensor algorithm verification across activity levels.

We evaluate electrical performance using specialized electrophysiology systems that capture pacing thresholds, sensing amplitudes, and impedance measurements with microsecond precision. Our catheterization laboratories feature programmable cardiac simulation systems enabling comprehensive pacing mode assessment and rate adaptation testing. Lead system testing evaluates conductor durability through accelerated fatigue protocols while biocompatibility assessment addresses chronic tissue contact requirements using ISO 10993 standards adapted for active implantable devices.

ISO 14708 series standards guide cardiac pacemaker assessment while FDA guidance documents for active implantable medical devices inform protocol development addressing electromagnetic compatibility, battery performance, and MRI conditional validation. Our GLP-compliant testing supports both 510(k) pathways demonstrating substantial equivalence and PMA submissions for breakthrough technologies. Whether validating traditional dual-chamber systems, leadless pacemaker platforms, or MRI-conditional devices, our protocols demonstrate electrical reliability, sensing accuracy, and long-term biocompatibility performance that regulatory submissions demand.
capability_1_description: Pacing output validation across voltage and pulse width ranges, sensing threshold assessment for P-wave and R-wave detection, and impedance measurement throughout chronic implantation with battery performance evaluation projecting device longevity under varying pacing burden scenarios
capability_2_title: Sensing Algorithm and Rate Adaptation Validation
capability_2_description: Detection sensitivity testing for intrinsic cardiac activity, noise rejection assessment for electromagnetic interference sources, and rate-responsive sensor evaluation validating physiological rate adaptation across activity levels and environmental conditions
capability_3_description: Chronic electrical integrity assessment evaluates conductor resistance stability, insulation performance under flexion stress, and lead-tissue interface impedance changes while mechanical durability protocols simulate years of cardiac motion through accelerated fatigue testing
capability_4_description: MRI conditional validation per ISO 14117 standards, electromagnetic interference susceptibility assessment across frequency ranges, and medical device interaction testing including exposure to electrocautery, defibrillators, and consumer electronics
capability_5_description: Long-term battery performance characterization under varying pacing burdens, end-of-life indicator validation, and replacement threshold assessment ensuring predictable device longevity for clinical management planning
capability_6_description: ISO 10993 testing adapted for active implantable devices addresses chronic tissue contact requirements with specialized protocols evaluating hemocompatibility for blood-contacting components, muscle stimulation effects, and tissue response at lead-myocardium interfaces
why_choose_title: Why Choose Synchrony for Pacemaker Testing
why_choose_1_description: Two catheterization laboratories equipped specifically for cardiac rhythm device evaluation feature programmable cardiac simulation systems, high-resolution ECG monitoring, and real-time hemodynamic assessment capabilities. Our electromagnetic compatibility chambers validate MRI conditional devices and interference immunity across multiple frequency ranges while specialized lead testing systems simulate millions of cardiac cycles through accelerated fatigue protocols. Battery performance assessment equipment characterizes longevity projections under varying clinical pacing scenarios.
why_choose_2_description: Founded by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered electrophysiology techniques, our team understands cardiac conduction systems, pacing algorithms, and sensing mechanisms specific to rhythm management devices. This cardiovascular heritage translates to protocol designs addressing FDA active implantable device requirements including electromagnetic compatibility demonstration through ISO 14117 compliance, battery longevity assessment, and the comprehensive safety validation life-sustaining pacemakers demand for decades of reliable cardiac pacing therapy.
why_choose_3_description: Our data packages have supported successful FDA submissions for cardiac pacemaker systems across single-chamber, dual-chamber, and rate-responsive platforms. We understand active implantable medical device requirements including electromagnetic compatibility demonstration, chronic biocompatibility validation, and the specific endpoints FDA expects for pacemaker submissions addressing both traditional lead-based systems and emerging leadless pacemaker technologies requiring novel implantation and sensing validation approaches.
cta_description: Our team is ready to discuss your pacemaker device, regulatory pathway, and study requirements to optimize your path to FDA approval.

hero_description: Comprehensive preclinical validation for implantable cardioverter defibrillators with arrhythmia detection algorithm testing, high-voltage defibrillation efficacy assessment, shock delivery characterization, and electromagnetic compatibility evaluation using GLP-compliant methodologies for life-sustaining device submissions.
primary_content_description:
Implantable cardioverter defibrillators prevent sudden cardiac death through rapid arrhythmia detection and high-voltage therapy delivery, requiring validation that demonstrates reliable detection algorithms while delivering effective defibrillation without unnecessary shocks. ICDs must discriminate life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias from benign rhythms while charging capacitors rapidly and delivering therapy that terminates fibrillation consistently. Transvenous systems demand comprehensive lead validation while subcutaneous platforms require alternative pathway characterization and CRT-D devices need biventricular pacing assessment alongside defibrillation capability.

We evaluate ICD performance using specialized electrophysiology systems that induce ventricular arrhythmias and assess detection accuracy with millisecond precision. Our high-voltage testing infrastructure characterizes defibrillation thresholds across energy levels while waveform optimization validates biphasic shock delivery effectiveness. Arrhythmia simulation capabilities test detection algorithms across varying ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation presentations while electromagnetic compatibility chambers assess device performance near MRI systems and medical equipment generating electromagnetic interference.

ISO 14708 series standards guide ICD assessment while FDA guidance documents for active implantable cardioverter defibrillators inform protocol development addressing defibrillation efficacy, sensing accuracy, and electromagnetic safety requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA pathways for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating traditional transvenous ICDs, subcutaneous systems avoiding intracardiac leads, or CRT-D platforms combining resynchronization and defibrillation therapy, our protocols demonstrate detection reliability, shock efficacy, and electromagnetic compatibility that sudden cardiac death prevention devices demand.
capability_1_description: Detection sensitivity testing across ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation presentations, specificity assessment for supraventricular tachycardia rejection, and rate discrimination validation with advanced algorithms including morphology analysis and sudden onset criteria undergoing comprehensive evaluation
capability_2_description: High-voltage testing characterizes defibrillation thresholds across multiple energy levels while waveform optimization validates biphasic shock delivery, capacitor charging performance evaluation, shock impedance measurement, and therapy success rate analysis addressing ICD-specific requirements
capability_3_description: Chronic electrical integrity assessment evaluates high-voltage conductor resistance stability, specialized insulation performance under defibrillation stress, and shock coil effectiveness while mechanical durability protocols simulate years of cardiac motion combined with periodic high-energy therapy delivery
capability_4_title: Electromagnetic Compatibility and MRI Conditional Validation
capability_4_description: MRI conditional testing per ISO 14117 standards validates device performance during imaging procedures, electromagnetic interference susceptibility assessment across frequency ranges, and medical device interaction testing including defibrillator exposure and electrocautery proximity scenarios
capability_5_description: Long-term battery characterization under varying shock delivery scenarios, capacitor charging time assessment across battery depletion states, and end-of-life indicator validation ensuring predictable device longevity for replacement planning despite unpredictable therapy requirements
capability_6_description: ISO 10993 testing adapted for high-voltage active implantable devices addresses chronic tissue contact with specialized protocols evaluating defibrillation lead hemocompatibility, shock electrode tissue response, and high-voltage component safety throughout extended implantation periods
why_choose_title: Why Choose Synchrony for ICD Testing

This cardiovascular heritage translates to protocol designs addressing FDA Class III requirements including defibrillation efficacy demonstration, electromagnetic compatibility validation, and the comprehensive safety evidence implantable cardioverter defibrillators demand for preventing sudden cardiac death across diverse patient populations.

We understand Class III life-sustaining device requirements including high-voltage system validation, arrhythmia detection algorithm assessment, and the specific endpoints FDA expects for ICD submissions addressing both traditional intracardiac lead systems and emerging subcutaneous technologies requiring alternative defibrillation pathway validation and unique electromagnetic compatibility considerations.
